text: Draft To øl totem passion. Mid hazy golden with a good white head. Malty, passion fruity, light grassy aroma. Very watery with taste of grass, fruity, water.... Very light and... Watery...

Kolor bladozłoty, niezbyt mętny. Dosć sztywna piana na początku, szybko opada i pozostawia okrąg na szkle. W zapachu głównie słody, cytrusy, marakuja gdzieś w tle. W smaku marakuja, delikatna chmielowa goryczka, owocowa kwaskowość. Mogłoby być nieco mniej wysycone, dość mało ciała. Mimo wszystko pije się baaardzo dobrze

Clear, light gold pour with a decent white head. Orange, passionfruit and light malt aromas. Taste is dry, slightly sour, fruity, low bitterness. For low ABV its fantastic, as a regular beer it punches way above its weight.

Can, 2.2%. Clear golden with tiny white head. Aroma is malt, fruit and a little passion fruit. Flaovur is malt, fruit, little passion fruit, little sour sourness, medium sweet, little thin, little over carbonated and a little dry.

090617. Can from Greenslopes Cellars. So little alcohol but so much flavour. While this beer may look a bit on the pale side it more than makes up for it in flavour. It was not as tart and sour as I was thinking it was going to be and there was a distinct passion fruit sweetness coming through.

Straw coloured. Solid aroma with citrusy hops and notes of fruit. Dry and tart taste, followed by light flavours of hops and fruit. Finishes lightly bitter. Light body. Overall, a rather average pale ale. The aroma is good, but I do not appreciate hops in dry beers. The passion fruit is also very discrete.

Can at Brus.
Clear golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hay and passionfruits.
Fruity flavour of passionfruits with notes of hops.
Fruity finish.

BB 21/11/17. Poured a hazy orangey-amber with a one-finger off-white frothy head that diminished quickly to a blotchy cap that laced very poorly. Carbonation low, average and coarse. Aroma subtly of sweet citrus with very low sourness; no real hops presence. Taste of lemony sourness with hints of sweet passionfruit; very low bitterness. Light body. Smooth with a thin mouthfeel and a moderately long finish that has both sweet fruitiness and hints of sourness. A better tasting low alcohol gluten-free beer.
I feel no passion for this totem... Way too much carbonation. Citrus in aroma and taste, but way to artificial tasting.

Sweet fruity and light hoppy aroma and taste, some tropical fruity accents, light body, packs in allot of flavour in for the abv. Impressive.

Bottle. Golden pour. Aroma of passion fruit, pale malt and citrus. Taste has fresh passion fruit, citrus, tart orange zest, pale malt and a bitter slightly sour finish. Hands down best low alcohol beer I ever had.

330ml bottle from Beergium. Hazy yellowy golden colour, white foam head and aroma of fruity passionfruit, grainy. Taste is tart, passionfruit, citric sourness, with some slight biscuit, grain & hay notes. Light bodied, soft to medium carbonation, dry sourish finish. Quite OK.
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange colour with a fluffy white head, aroma is light and hoppy, the taste is medium bitterness with some citrus coming through with a dry bitter finish.
Clear golden, no head. Aroma of citrusy hops, lemon, grass. Watery body, a bit tart, refreshing. Bitter/sour finish. Not bad.

33cl can @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 12-02-2017.
"VII Cata Ratebeer Asturias".
BBD: 21-11-2017. 2,2%.
In short: nice fruity ale.
Pours hazy pale gold with nice white head. Moderate head retention, little lacing.Citrusy nose. Light body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is moderate bitter, tropical fruits, mango, passion fruit. Some dry aftertaste. Good.

Bottle from Beergium. Aroma is tart fruits, passion fruit, tropical, citrus, lemon, light bready malts Flavour is mildly sour and very slightly bitter. Body is light. Thin but very aromatic with passion fruit, tropical fruits, tart lemon, nice mild sour/tartness. Good.

330 ml. bottle. BBF 21/11/18. Bright near clear golden, brief white head. Nose is lightly metallic, mineral, touch stale with lemon juice low To Øl lemon sour profile. Nose is bit stale, mineral, taste is definitely better. Taste is basic lemon sour, refreshing, faintly mineral, low fluffy stale cornbread malts, basic lemon juice, idea of metallic. Soft carbonation, vaguely metallic lemon juice body. Pretty simple & refreshing. For a low ABV gluten free fruit beer, this is stupidly good. More lemon juice than passion fruit for me.

Aroma citrico, color dorado liviano, sabor suavemente amargo con un rico acidez y un toque salado. Se siente maracuya y citrico. Refrescante. No soy mucho de cervezas de 2.2° pero este vale la pena repetir.
33 cL bottle. Pours cloudy yellow, small white head. Aroma is passion fruity, Citrusy. Lingering sourish and citrusy passion fruit. Light fruity far finish.
Can at Gollem. Hazy golden color. Aroma of papery fruit. Taste is light fruit. OK.

Pours clear blonde, small white head. Smell is intense, fruity, malts, mild sou touch taste is sour, dry, but both aspects are very balanced, not extreme at all. Full taste. Fruit is very very mild, easy drinkable, yet full in flavor.
33cl bottle. Hazy orange color. Thin white head. Medium bitterness. Thin crispy body. Aroma and flavour is passion fruit, grapefruit, pineapple, mango, herby.
Lata @VII Cata Ratebeer Asturias, 12/02/17. Color amarillo, aroma cítrico, sabor cítrico intenso, fruta, refrescante, cuerpo ligero.

Lata 33 cl VII cata ratebeer en Cimmeria 12..02..2017. (r00). Ligeros ácidos cítricos cortezas de limon y herbaceos frescos con ligeras frutas tropicales. Cuerpo ligero algo espumoso y con bastante sabor para sus 2.2 vol. Buena. Refrescante. Para repetir.
